alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:32AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Buchanan and northern Benton Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 331 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairbank to 9 miles west of Keystone. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fairbank around 335 AM CDT. Dysart around 345 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Garrison, Vinton, Mount Auburn, Brandon and Urbana. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 40 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
